result.execSummary:
The defendant Delon Donte Grady was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court orders withheld sentence, with credit for 6 days served.
Court grants transfer of probation to Grant County.

miscConds.notes:
AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety, random urine samples.

No possession or use of illegal drugs and alcohol.
No new law violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
No contact with any Milwaukee County Walmarts.
Cooperate with agent and attend any treatment and/or counseling as determined.

Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Court set restitution at zero.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Delon Donte Grady

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Delon Donte Grady in court.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Delon Donte Grady.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. Amended Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 

Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

Court orders with held sentence, with credit for 6 days served. Court STAYED the sentence(s) and placed the defendant on probation for 9 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Cooporate with agent and attend any treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, random urine samples.
- No possession or use of illegal drugs and alcohol.
- No new law violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
- No contact with any Milwaukee County Walmarts
- Provide a DNA sample. 

Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
* Court grants transfer of probation to Grant County.

JusticePoint Violation Report dated May 12, 2022 - received

Defendant Delon Grady in court.  Attorney Darryl Smith via zoom.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held via zoom.  Defense is requesting an addtional status conference date.  The court will grant defense request and order the matter adjourned back to Branch 2 via zoom.
 Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-27-2022.

Defendant Delon Donte Grady in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith; both appear by video.  Defendant Delon Donte Grady in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed
No contact order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Defendant must attend all future court dates.

Pretrial Order, signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ALL Walmarts in MKE.

DAR UNAVAILABLE DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES.  CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defendant Delon Donte Grady in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Delon Donte Grady in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Delon Donte Grady appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
